summary: A character reference letter written to Judge Alison J. Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell, requesting bail. The author, whose name is redacted, describes Maxwell as a strong, inspiring woman and a positive influence, aiming to provide a personal perspective outside of media coverage.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the character reference letter, for whom the author is requesting bail. Described as a strong, inspiring woman with a passion for saving oceans.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the character reference letter is addressed.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Character reference letter submitted
events.description: A character reference letter is written to Judge Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell, requesting bail.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A character reference letter was submitted to Judge Alison J. Nathan on December 7, 2020, advocating for Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail.
The author, whose name is redacted, describes Maxwell as a strong, inspiring woman and a positive personal influence.
The letter explicitly states it is not intended to discuss the charges or argue guilt/innocence, but to offer a personal perspective on Maxwell.
The letter is part of the court record for the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
